alert.note: Alert for Bighorn Canyon; Pryor, Northern Bighorn Mountains; Southern Big Horn (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 19 at 10:09PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Big Horn and southeastern Carbon Counties through 1045 PM MDT... At 1008 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles northeast of Horseshoe Bend, or 22 miles northeast of Lovell, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Fort Smith and Crow Indian Reservation, Bighorn Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Bighorn Canyon; Pryor, Northern Bighorn Mountains; Southern Big Horn
